text:
The patient is a 70 yo man with h/o DM2, HTN, and recent diagnoses of
   AFib who was transferred from OSH for further evaluation of pericardial
   effusion.
   He was dx with Afib beginning of [**Month (only) **].  started on coumadin by PMD. Was
   also started on diuretic prior to this.    Presented to [**Hospital3 **]
   [**12-27**] with increase Dyspnea  and chills.   was intubated in EW there.
   Rx with diuresis and dilt gtt.  He was extubated [**1-6**].  Chest CT
   showing large pericardial effusion and multilfocal PNA.  Started on
   IVAB.
   Attempted TEE/CDV however unable dt report of atrial clot.  Repeat CT
   showed increase in pericardial effusion and he was transferred to [**Hospital1 19**]
   for care.
   Of note; post extubation pt. had change in MS and confusion.  Head CT
   c/w toxic metabolic encephalopathy.
   Pericardial effusion with tamponade
   Assessment:
   Pericardial drain intact.  Bloody drainage.  Denies pain.  HR 70
   aflutter.  BP 130-150
s/60
   Right fem. Cath site D/I.  pulses palp.
   Action:
   Maintained integrity of drain.  Monitored drainage.
   Cotin. On lopressor, dilt , amlodipine pNGT
   Response:
   Plan:
   Delirium / confusion
   Assessment:
   Pt. oriented to self only.  Becoming more restless, agitated through
   the evening
.picking, trying to get OOB, swinging legs over
   siderails.   taking off oxygen.  Becoming increase safety risk.
   Talking to self, yelling out. Asking for beer and cigarettes.
   Action:
   Soft wrist restraints placed bilat.  Zyprexa 5mg PNGT at 2200.
   Response:
   Quieter but contin. With delirium/confusion. Awake all night. Ox1 only.
    Yelling out.
   Moving all extremeties equally.  Hands restrained.
   Plan:
   Pneumonia, bacterial, ventilator acquired (VAP)
   Assessment:
   Course, rhonchorous BS bilat.   Initially on NRB 100% with sats
   96-98%.   However, sats dropping to 80% when pt. pulling O2 off  (prior
   to hands restrained).
   Strong cough,  but unable to bring secretions up.  Collect in back of
   throat requiring deep subglottal suction for thick blood tinged
   secretions.
   Action:
   Changed over to 95% high flow mask for humidity.  Alb/Atrovent nebs
   q6hr.
   VAP care q2-4 hour with oral suction as needed.
   Response:
   Sats 92-95% on mask.
   Plan:
